column4: whats the difference between linux, linux-image and linux-image-2.6.12?
is the default kernel as 2.4 kernel?
linux-image-686, for example, depends on linux-image-2.6.12-9-686 (the current version for that architecture)
make sense?
so which kernel should i pick?
it's a good idea to use linux-686, or the architecture of your choice, so it pulls in other dependencies, like the matching linux-restricted-modules
there is no linux-image-2.6.12 without an associated architecture
well, the options are linux-ppc, linux-image-ppc, linux-image-2.6.12-ppc
linux-ppc
not sure why the installer offers those
please try sudo apt-get -f install
also, you can try sudo dpkg --configure --pending
they do different things.  Without knowing what's going on with your install, we need to try both.
I realize that, but you shouldn't be getting any errors
I'm back
can you elaborate on the error you're getting during install?
after i install base system, it reboots
what size disk are you installing on?
that's not really enough.
the Apple key
the channel topic mentions that us.archive.ubuntu.com is down
use another archive (such as archive.ubuntu.com, without the "us" at the beginning)
or anyone else.. after i've changed sources, how do i restart the install to pick up where it left off at installing the packages after the base install is done
